section.title: LVM Setup
section.para: Which &xen; their are two modes of operation, paravirualization or full virtualization. Paravirualization is faster but requires the kernels of the management domain and the kernel of the &vm; to pass requests to each other. Paravirualization is a faster techinque for virtualisation but has the disadvantage in that guests have to use modified kernels.

If you are using paravirtualization in Xen you can also export only partitions without the virtual maschine even having a disk, this is recomeneded if you have a paravirtualizable client OS such as Linux, Solaris and maybe Plan9 Kernels. 2 Partitions are recomended for parvitualized systems should have swap space for the Virtual Maschine's Virtual Memmory. With Linux guests It changes the booting complications but provides an improved performance since the hypovisor mearly gives access control.
For exported partinion images each slot should have root=/dev/sbird/vm001sys swap=/dev/sbird/vm001swap type attributes depending upon your virtulized host name and LVM vollume group.

For exported disks each slot should have its attribute set so vmimagemanager knows which files system to mount from the virtual disks. for a set of library images are loaded on two a set of slots. You must decide how to organize this. I recommend buying some fresh large storage half a tera byte, attached via SATA or better storeage infrastructure.

splinting the content 50/50 with space against running images, and create the partitions on demand if you dont intend to uses as many images or less static images. If your intending running less . vmimagemanager works for maximum performance of linux virtualization hence supporting xen. This allows the use of para-virtulization where the best performance exists currently although I have not seen comparative data with solaris containers.

At this moment Xen and 3d graphics and advanced graphics interactions has led to data loaded on the screen, files system corruption and crashes. For this reason I suggest removing your login manager (gdm, kdm , xdm) and shutting down X11 and using ssh to log into your xen server in my case an ultra portable laptop with a large USB drive which is a little slow but to work on my desktop is just wrong!.
